Dear Katrina Edmon:
Attached is the Special Investigation Report for the above referenced facility. Due to the
violations identified in the report, a corrective action plan is required. The corrective action
plan is due 15 days from the date of this letter, must be completed and routed in CWLM,
and must include the following:
• How compliance with each rule will be achieved.
• For any repeat violations, why the prior corrective action plan did not result
in compliance.
• Who is directly responsible for implementing the corrective action for each
violation.
• Specific time frames for each violation as to when the action steps will be
completed or implemented.
• How continuing compliance will be maintained once compliance is
achieved.
• The signature of the responsible party and a date.
If you desire technical assistance in addressing these issues, please feel free to contact
me. In any event, the corrective action plan is due within 15 days. Failure to submit an
acceptable corrective action plan will result in disciplinary action.
Please review the enclosed documentation for accuracy and contact me with any
questions. In the event that I am not available, and you need to speak to someone
immediately please contact the area manager, Rorie Dodge-Pifer at (517) 899-6024.

III. INVESTIGATION
Rule Code & CCI Rule 400.4158
Section (1) A child caring institution shall establish and follow written
Description policies and procedures that prohibit the following forms of
intervention: (a) Any type of physical punishment including, but not
limited to: (iv) Verbal abuse including the use of derogatory or
discriminatory language including negative references to a youth's
background or appearance or mental state. Yelling, threats,
ridicule, or humiliation are strictly prohibited.
Violation Potential Rule or Statute Violation
Type
Allegation Last night, a youth had a verbal altercation with a staff member.
The staff member was upset that the youth was speaking to other
youth in the cottage. The staff member called the youth a
derogatory name and the youth then called the staff member the
same insult. The staff member threw their belongings down and
tried to attack the youth. The youth ran to another cottage to alert
their therapist, and the therapist told the youth to talk about the
issue with the staff member. The youth returned and asked the
staff member to talk, but the staff member refused and tried to
attack the youth again.
Investigation Interviews:
On 04/23/2025 a telephone call was made to Complainant. They
denied any additional concerns and reported that they assessed
that the youth was doing well at the agency.
On 04/23/2025 an email correspondence was sent to FCW
advising of allegations and requesting a response regarding any
concerns with youth or with the placement agency. An email
response was received on 04/24/2025 and FCW denied having
any concerns regarding the placement of the youth.
On 04/24/2025 SI was initiated onsite at Methodist.
On 04/24/2025 a face to face meeting was held with Senior
Residential Director (SRD). Chief Administrator was also
present via telephone. The allegations of the investigation were
provided and policy documentation requested.
On 04/24/2025 an interview was held with Youth A at Methodist.
He reported having a good relationship with Staff 1. He reported
having a small “run in” with her the other day. He reported that
Staff 1 put some false reports about him in the staff group chat
2

and he approached her to talk about it. Youth A reported that he
felt “tension” between the two of them, so he told her that he was
not planning to try to fight her and only wanted to talk. Youth A
stated that he believed it was some miscommunication, and that
Staff 1 thought he said he wanted to fight her. He reported that
Staff 1 put all her items down and got into a “fighting stance” and
asked him “what he wanted to do”? Youth A reported he
responded by preparing himself to “fight” also. He denied that he
hit Staff 1 or that she hit him. He reported that another staff, who
he did not remember, encouraged him to go outside and get some
fresh air. Youth A reported that he went to another area and was
able to calm down. He stated that he and Staff 1 were able to talk
briefly and agreed to take a break and discuss it when both were
calm. Youth A denied any concerns with Staff 1 and stated that
she is “fun” to be around and advocates for him. He confirmed
that Staff 1 did not hit him and denied ever seeing her hit any
other youth. Youth A also reported that he discussed the incident
with his therapist the next day. He acknowledged that he is
“sassy and disrespectful” with his mouth, but he is working on it.
On 4/24/2025 an interview was completed with Therapist at
Methodist. She reported having worked with Youth A for 3 to 4
months. She reported that she spoke with him very briefly the
next day about the incident with Staff 1. She recalled that Youth A
stated that Staff 1 thought he was being disrespectful, when he
was not. Therapist reported she advised Youth A to utilize some
of his coping skills that they have worked on, i.e. taking a break,
walking away, having a calm conversation. Therapist denied that
Youth A advised her that Staff 1 hit him. She also denied
knowledge of Staff 1 being physically aggressive with other youth.
On 04/24/2025 an interview was held with Staff 1 at Methodist.
She reported that Youth A was upset about information that he
thought was incorrectly shared with other staff about his behavior.
She returned from a store run and reported that Youth A was
escalated and making statements that she was trying to get him
into trouble. She stated that Youth A started acting as if he was
going to “run up on her” and was trying to get around staff. She
could not recalling the name of the staff member. Staff 1 stated
that she took off her apple watch, glasses and air pods and said to
Youth A, “if you hit me, it’s gonna be a problem”. She was asked
what she meant by the statement, and she indicated “I was going
to protect myself. If he hit me, I was going to hit him back”. When
asked, she confirmed that she got into a “protective stance” in an
attempt to prepare to protect herself. Staff 1 denied hitting Youth
A or any other youth in the program. Staff 1 also shared concerns
3

about interactions she has seen between youth and other staff.
She reported that she witnessed Staff 2 yelling at Youth B and
calling him retarded. She further stated that Staff 2 was
“antagonizing” Youth B and even followed him into another area
when he was removed from an area by staff in an attempt to get
him to calm down. This allegation is being investigated under SI#
2025SIC0000604.
On 05/01/2025 and interview was completed with Supervisor 1 at
Methodist. She denied being at work on the day of the reported
incident between Youth A and Staff 1. She denied knowledge of
Staff 1 hitting Youth A or any other youth at the agency. She
stated staff attempts to hold youth accountable and discourage
them from feeding into negative behavior. She lastly reported
having a good relationship with Youth A but stated that he often
feeds into negative behavior.
On 05/01/2025 an interview was held with Staff 3 at Methodist.
He recalled the incident that occurred between Youth A and Staff
1. He stated that he could hear the incident but was unable to see
it. He could hear Youth A yelling at staff and recalled that he was
upset because he thought Staff 1 was engaging with other youth
instead of him. Staff 3 recalled hearing Staff 1 yelling for Youth A
to “back up”. Staff 3 did not recall what other staff were working
that day. He denied hearing or seeing Staff 1 be hit or be
otherwise inappropriate with Youth A.
On 05/01/2025 an interview was held with Supervisor 2 at
Methodist. He denied knowledge of any negative interactions
between Staff 1 and Youth A. He reported that at first Staff 1 was
the favorite employee of Youth A, but that it later changed. He
recalled responding for assistance and being present at the end of
the altercation. He reported Staff 1 was trying to walk away, but
Youth A continue to yell and walk toward her. Staff 3 was
present, but was not doing a good job of deescalating Youth A.
Supervisor 2 reported hearing Staff 1 say “I’m not like the other
staff, I’m not gonna let him hit me”. Supervisor 2 reported walking
Staff 1 to the office and engaged in some mentoring with her.
Supervisor 2 denied that Staff 1 hit Youth A. He denied having
knowledge of Staff 1 hitting youth at the agency or engaging in
inappropriate behavior with them.
On 05/01/2025 an interview was completed with Youth C and
Youth D at Methodist. They both denied seeing or hearing about
an incident between Youth A and Staff 1. Youth C reported that
4

he gets along well with Staff 1. Both youth denied seeing her hit
any youth at the agency.
Documents Reviewed:
Methodist Agency Policy: Discipline and Consequences Policy -
Employees will only adhere to the behavior management
techniques as taught by MCHS. MCHS does not sanction any
form of corporal punishment and or inappropriate hands-on
intervention such as but not limited to pinching, spanking,
slapping, hitting, twisting arms, paddling, pulling hair, grabbing
pushing and threatening gestures.
Methodist Incident Report – Dated 4/21/2025 and written by Staff
1 – IR indicates reason as threatening language and verbal
aggression. It involved Youth A and Staff 1 at Junke Hall at
approximately 6:35pm. Documents that Youth A did not want to
be redirected and was being aggressive towards Staff 1 and
began to try to attack Staff 1. They were separated and Staff 1
indicated she left the area as she was a trigger.
Tour of Agency:
On 05/01/2025 a tour of the area where the incident occurred was
completed. It was noted that at the time of the incident, the
cameras were not operative as a result of damage by a youth.
The cottage and surrounding area was found to be well
maintained and no areas of concern were noted.
Analysis At the conclusion of the investigation, the agency was found to be
in non-compliance with the licensing rule. Interviews were
completed with both youth and staff at the agency. Staff 1
reported her intent to "protect herself" and admitted threatening
the youth and stated if he hit her, she was going to hit him back.
Technical Assistance:
• Recommendation for agency to train staff to include
witnesses in the incident report and have other staff
present to also complete an incident report for detailed
documentation.
Conclusion Repeat Violation Established

Based on investigative findings the facility is not in compliance with all applicable
licensing statutes and rules. A corrective action plan is required.
